name: @jelle/cirra-ai
description:
The Cirra AI MCP server provides comprehensive Salesforce administration and data management capabilities. 

This server allows you to configure connections with multiple Salesforce organizations via OAuth , organize them by teams, and set access controls.
 
The robust set of tools covers all major Salesforce APIs -- both for data and metadata, and supports use cases like:
✅ Documenting orgs and cleaning up technical debt
✅ Creating custom objects, fields, and page layouts
✅ Provisioning users, assigning permission sets and managing queues and groups
✅ Building or updating flows

And much more...

tools.name: logout

annotations.title: Logout from Cirra AI MCP server

tools.description: Logout from Cirra AI MCP server

tools.name: cirra_ai_init
tools.description:
IMPORTANT: call `cirra_ai_init` before calling any other tools of this MCP server or when you don't know the answer to a request which relates to Cirra AI or Salesforce.
This tool will return the following info:
- Important instructions
- System context
- User info
- User subscription details
- Cirra AI contact & support information
You MUST carefully read the instructions returned from this tool call before proceeding

tools.name: link_build
tools.description: Build Salesforce links for setup pages. Always use this tool when user requests a setup page link

type.description: The type of the link to build
The type of the setup page

sObjectNameOrId.description: The sObject API name or ID. Provide this for any artifact that is related to a specific sObject

artifactNameOrId.description: The name or ID of artifact. For example a class name, class ID, page layout name, validation rule name, value set name, trigger name, flow name, username, user ID or flow name

setupConfig.description: Used with `setup` types. Describes the type of setup page to build link for

tools.name: sf_org_describe
tools.description: Describe the current connected Salesforce organization

tools.name: sf_orgs_list
tools.description: List all the Salesforce organizations that the current user has access to

tools.name: sf_org_select
tools.description: Select a Salesforce organization to use for the current session. (aka: switch organization, change organization)

user_id.description: ID of the Salesforce user to select

organization_id.description: ID of the Salesforce organization to select

tools.name: sf_org_add
tools.description: Add a Salesforce organization to the current session. (Also referred to as: connect new organization, authenticate new organization)

tools.name: sf_org_reauthenticate
tools.description: Reauthorize a connected Salesforce organization. (Also referred to as: refresh organization, reauthenticate organization)

user_id.description: ID of the Salesforce user to reauthenticate

organization_id.description: ID of the Salesforce organization to reauthenticate

tools.name: sf_org_remove
tools.description: Remove a Salesforce organization from the current session

user_id.description: ID of the Salesforce user to remove

organization_id.description: ID of the Salesforce organization to remove

tools.name: sobjects_list
tools.description: Lists all the available sObject types and provides some of their key properties including ID, name, label and type. To get more details about an sObject, use `sobject_describe`

customObjectsOnly.description: if true, list only custom objects

tools.name: sobject_describe
tools.description: Return basic metadata properties for the specified sObject, as well as a list of fields, relationships and record types.

sObject.description: The API name, label or ID of the sObject

tools.name: sobject_update
tools.description: Update properties of a custom object in Salesforce

sObject.description: The API name, label or ID of the custom sObject

properties.description: A map of properties to update on the object. For example: 'label'. At least one property must be updated

tools.name: sobject_create
tools.description: Create a new custom Salesforce object in Salesforce

label.description: The human readable label for the field. If it is not provided, use the sObject property after stripping any suffix, replacing underscores with spaces and capitalizing the elements

sObject.description: The name of the object. For example, Account.

description.description: Provides a description of the object's purpose. Generate a value for this if it is not provided

pluralLabel.description: The plural version of the human readable label for the field

enableSearch.description: Whether to enable search for the object. Default is false

enableHistory.description: Whether to enable field history tracking for the object

enableReports.description: Whether to enable reports for the object

nameFieldType.description: The type of the name field. Options are `AutoNumber` or `Text` (the default)

nameFieldLabel.description: The label for the name field. Defaults to `<obj label> Name`

enableActivities.description: Whether to enable activities for the object

allowInChatterGroups.description: Whether to allow the object to be used in Chatter groups

nameFieldDisplayFormat.description: For `AutoNumber` name fields only: the format to use for the display of the auto-number. For example, `A-{0000}`

nameFieldStartingNumber.description: For `AutoNumber` name fields only: the starting number for the auto-number. For example, `1000`

tools.name: sobject_relations_list
tools.description: Return full metadata properties for all the child relations of a Salesforce object, including API name, label and target type

sObject.description: The API name, label or ID of the sObject

tools.name: sobject_relation_describe
tools.description: Completely describe the metadata for an sObject child relationship in Salesforce

sObject.description: The API name, label or ID of the sObject

relationshipName.description: The API name or label of the relationship.

tools.name: sobject_fields_list
tools.description: Lists all the fields of the specified sObject and provides some of their key properties including ID, name, label and type. To get more details about the field, use sobject_field_describe

sObject.description: The API name, label or ID of the sObject

tools.name: sobject_field_describe
tools.description: Return all metadata properties for a field on an sObject in Salesforce

sObject.description: The API name, label or ID of the sObject

fieldName.description: The API name, label or ID of the field. For example Industry, Segment__c, SomeNamespace__SomeField__c, 'Some Field' or 00NEk00000B8BYE.

tools.name: sobject_field_create
tools.description: Create a new custom field for an sObject in Salesforce

sObject.description: The API name, label or ID of the sObject

fieldName.description: The API name of the new field. For example, NewField__c

defaultFLS.description: The default Field-Level Security (FLS) setting to apply for all profiles for the new field

properties.description: A map of properties used when creating the field. Some may be required, depending on the field type. See instructions for details

profile.description: The name or ID of the profile

visibility.description: The Field-Level Security (FLS) setting for the given profile

flsOverrides.description: An (optional) array of Field-Level Security (FLS) overrides for one or more profiles

tools.name: sobject_field_update
tools.description: Update properties of a custom sObject field (standard or custom) in Salesforce, including local picklist values

sObject.description: The API name, label or ID of the sObject

fieldName.description: The API name, label or ID of the field. For example Industry, Segment__c, SomeNamespace__SomeField__c, 'Some Field' or 00NEk00000B8BYE.

profile.description: The name or ID of the profile

visibility.description: The Field-Level Security (FLS) setting to update for the given profile

flsUpdates.description: An (optional) array of Field-Level Security (FLS) settings to update for one or more profiles

properties.description: Properties to update. Some are required, depending on the field type. See instructions for details

tools.name: permission_set_describe
tools.description: Return complete metadata for a permission set in Salesforce

namespace.description: The namespace of the permission set, if applicable

permissionSet.description: The name or ID of the permission set.

tools.name: permission_set_create
tools.description: Create a new permission set in Salesforce

name.description: The name of the permission set.

label.description: The label of the permission set.

license.description: The permission set license or the user license associated with this permission set.

description.description: The description of the permission set.

hasActivationRequired.description: Whether the permission set requires activation.

tools.name: permission_set_update
tools.description: Update the properties or contents of a permission set in Salesforce, including read and edit access to objects and fields

from.description: For move and copy operations only: a JSON Pointer path specifying the source

path.description: An enhanced JSON Pointer path specifying where the change should be applied.

value.description: The value to add, replace, or test. Set to null for move and copy operations

patch.description: The array of modifications that need to be applied. This should be provided in the `JSON Patch` format

namespace.description: The namespace of the permission set, if applicable

permissionSet.description: The name or ID of the permission set.

tools.name: permission_set_assignments_add
tools.description: Add permission set assignments to users in Salesforce

anyOf.description: The names, usernames or IDs of the users who we want to assign the permission sets to
The names, usernames or IDs of the users who we want to assign the permission sets to
The names, labels or IDs of the permission sets that we want to assign
The names, labels or IDs of the permission sets that we want to assign

tools.name: permission_set_assignments_remove
tools.description: Remove permission set assignments from users in Salesforce

anyOf.description: The names, usernames or IDs of the users from whom we want to remove the assignments
The names, usernames or IDs of the users from whom we want to remove the assignments
The names, labels or IDs of the permission sets that we want to remove assignments for
The names, labels or IDs of the permission sets that we want to remove assignments for

tools.name: permission_set_assignments_list
tools.description: Get permission set assignments for the specified user(s) and/or permission set(s)

anyOf.description: The names, usernames or IDs of the users for whom we want to find the assignments
The names, usernames or IDs of the users for whom we want to find the assignments
The names, labels or IDs of the permission sets for which we want to find the assignments
The names, labels or IDs of the permission sets for which we want to find the assignments

tools.name: group_describe
tools.description: Return full metadata for a public group, queue or role in Salesforce

group.description: The name or ID of the public group, queue or role.

tools.description: Create a new public group, queue or role in Salesforce

type.description: The type of group to create

label.description: The label for the group. Will be generated from the name if not provided.

supportedObjects.description: The objects that the queue can access

tools.name: group_update
tools.description: Update a public group or queue in Salesforce

group.description: The name or ID of the public group or queue.

tools.name: group_members_add
tools.description: Add users to one or more public groups or queues in Salesforce

anyOf.description: The names, usernames or IDs of the users who we want to add to the groups
The names, usernames or IDs of the users who we want to add to the groups
The names or IDs of the groups or queues to add the users to
The names or IDs of the groups or queues to add the users to

tools.name: group_members_remove
tools.description: Remove users from one or more public groups or queues in Salesforce

anyOf.description: The names, usernames or IDs of the users who we want to remove from the groups
The names, usernames or IDs of the users who we want to remove from the groups
The names or IDs of the groups or queues to remove the users from
The names or IDs of the groups or queues to remove the users from

tools.name: group_members_list
tools.description: Get group memberships for public groups, queues or roles and/or specified users. Both groups and users are optional, but at least one must be provided.

anyOf.description: The names, usernames or IDs of the users for whom we want to find the groups
The names, usernames or IDs of the users for whom we want to find the groups
The names, labels or IDs of the public groups, queues or roles for which we want to find the members
The names, labels or IDs of the public groups, queues or roles for which we want to find the members

recursive.description: Whether to recursively explore sub-groups to find members. Defaults to false

tools.name: value_set_describe
tools.description: Return values of a standard or global value set in Salesforce

name.description: The name or ID of the value set

type.description: Indicate whether this is a global or standard value set. Not needed if the ID of the value set is provided

namespace.description: The namespace for a global value set, if applicable

tools.name: value_set_create
tools.description: Create a new global value set in Salesforce

name.description: The name of the value set

sorted.description: Set to true if the values should be sorted

default.description: Set to true if this is the default value

fullName.description: The full name of the value

isActive.description: Set to true if the value is active

values.description: The values for the value set

masterLabel.description: The label (optional). Will default to the name if not specified

tools.name: value_set_update
tools.description: Update the values in a standard or global value set in Salesforce

name.description: The name or ID of the value set

type.description: Indicate whether this is a global or standard value set. Not needed if the ID of the value set is provided

won.description: Set to true if the value represents a won opportunity. Only relevant for the OpportunityStage picklist

closed.description: Set to true if the value represents a closed opportunity. Only relevant for the OpportunityStage picklist

default.description: Set to true if this is the default value

fullName.description: The full name of the value

isActive.description: Set to true if the value is active

converted.description: Set to true if the value represents a converted lead. Only relevant for the LeadStatus picklist

probability.description: Indicates the conversion probability (0-100) for the value. Only relevant for the OpportunityStage picklist

forecastCategory.description: Indicates the forecast category for the value. Only relevant for the OpportunityStage picklist

values.description: The values for the value set

namespace.description: The namespace for a global value set, if applicable

tools.name: user_describe
tools.description: Return complete metadata for a Salesforce user

user.description: The name, username, email or ID of the user

tools.name: user_create
tools.description: Create a new Salesforce user. You can clone an existing user by providing the `template` parameter, or create a new user from scratch by providing the `profile` and other parameters

profile.description: The name or ID of the profile to use for the new user. Not required if template is provided

lastName.description: The last name of the user

template.description: The name, username, email or id of an existing user to use a a template for the new user

username.description: The username of the user. Must be globally unique across all Salesforce organizations

firstName.description: The first name of the user

properties.description: An optional map of additional properties to set on the new user

tools.name: user_update
tools.description: Perform an update operation on a Salesforce user

user.description: The id, username, full name or email of the user to update

operation.description:
The type of operation to perform. Can be one of:
- `deactivate`: To deactivate a user
- `activate`: To activate a user
- `reset_password`: To reset password of a user. An email to reset password will be sent to the user's email
- `freeze`: To freeze a user
- `unfreeze`: To unfreeze a user
- `unlock_password`: To unlock password for a user
- `update`

properties.description: The properties to update when choosing the `update` operation

tools.name: profile_describe
tools.description: Return detailed metadata for a Salesforce Profile.

profile.description: The name or ID of the Profile.

sObject.description: Use this to return only permissions related to the a specific sObject type.

permissionTypes.description: List of specific permission types to return. Use this whenever possible (especially for standard profiles) to reduce the size of the response.

tools.name: profile_create
tools.description: Create a new Salesforce profile from a JSON object

profileJson.description: A JSON serialised array of a Metadata.Profile object, including only the relevant elements

userLicenseName.description: Licence type for the profile. For example, Salesforce

tools.name: profile_clone
tools.description: Clone an existing user profile in Salesforce

profile.description: The name of the new Profile

clonedProfileName.description: The name of existing Profile which will be cloned

tools.name: profile_update
tools.description: Update a user profile in Salesforce

from.description: For move and copy operations only: a JSON Pointer path specifying the source

path.description: An enhanced JSON Pointer path specifying where the change should be applied.

value.description: The value to add, replace, or test. Set to null for move and copy operations

patch.description: The array of modifications that need to be applied. This should be provided in the `JSON Patch` format

profile.description: The name or ID of the Profile

tools.name: page_layout_describe
tools.description: Return complete metadata for a given page layout in Salesforce

layout.description: The name or ID of the layout. ID is preferred if you have it. If using a name, you must also provide the sObject

sObject.description: The name of the sObject to which the layout applies. Not needed if you have provided the layout ID

namespace.description: The namespace prefix of the Page Layout. Not needed if you have provided the layout ID or if the layout has no namespace

tools.name: page_layout_create
tools.description: Create a new page layout from scratch in Salesforce

sObject.description: The name of the object to which the layout applies. Include a namespace prefix for custom objects if applicable

layoutName.description: The name of the new layout

layoutSections.description: An JSON serialised array of Metadata.LayoutSection which MUST include the required fields for the object

tools.name: page_layout_update
tools.description: update the properties or contents of a page layout, include adding or removing fields in Salesforce

from.description: For move and copy operations only: a JSON Pointer path specifying the source

path.description: A JSON Pointer path specifying where the change should be applied

value.description: The value to add, replace, or test. Not required for move and copy operations

patch.description: The array of modifications that need to be applied. This should be provided in the `JSON Patch` format

layout.description: The name or ID of the layout. ID is preferred if you have it. If using a name, you must also provide the sObject

sObject.description: The name of the sObject to which the layout applies. Not needed if you have provided the layout ID

namespace.description: The namespace prefix of the Page Layout. Not needed if you have provided the layout ID or if the layout has no namespace

tools.name: page_layout_clone
tools.description: Create a new page layout by cloning an existing layout in Salesforce

layout.description: The name or ID of the existing layout to clone. ID is preferred if you have it. If using a name, you must also provide the sObject

sObject.description: The name of the sObject to which the layout applies. Not needed if you have provided the layout ID

namespace.description: The namespace prefix of the existing layout to clone. Not needed if you have provided the layout ID or if the layout has no namespace

newLayoutName.description: Name of the new (cloned) page layout to create

tools.name: record_type_describe
tools.description: Describe an sObject record type in Salesforce

sObject.description: The name of the object

recordType.description: The name or ID of the record type to update

tools.name: record_type_create
tools.description: Create a new sObject record type in Salesforce

name.description: The name of the new record type

label.description: The label for the new record type

active.description: Whether the new record type should be active

sObject.description: The name of the object for which the record type is being created. Include a namespace prefix for custom objects if applicable

description.description: The description for the new record type

defaultLayout.description: The default layout to use for all profiles. If not provided, the default layout will be the standard layout for the object

businessProcess.description: The full name or ID of the business process associated with the record type

existingRecordType.description: The name of the existing record type to use as a basis for the new record type. If not provided, the Master record type will be used

defaultAvailability.description: The default availability settings for the new record type on all profiles. If not specified, the record type will be hidden for all profiles

profile.description: The name or ID of the profile

availability.description: The record type availability for the given profile

availabilityOverrides.description: An (optional) array of record type availabilities overrides for one or more profiles

compactLayoutAssignment.description: The compact layout that is assigned to the record type.

layout.description: The name or ID of the layout to assign for the profile

profile.description: The name or ID of the profile

layoutAssignmentOverrides.description: An (optional) array of page layout assignments overrides for one or more profiles

tools.name: record_type_update
tools.description: Update or activate/deactivate an sObject record type in Salesforce

active.description: Use this property to activate or deactivate a record type

sObject.description: The name of the object

recordType.description: The name or ID of the record type to update

description.description: The updated description of the record type

defaultLayout.description: The default layout to use for all profiles. If not provided, the default layout will be the standard layout for the object

businessProcess.description: The name of the business process associated with the record type

defaultAvailability.description: The default availability settings for the new record type

profile.description: The name or ID of the profile

availability.description: The record type availability for the given profile

availabilityOverrides.description: An (optional) array of record type availabilities overrides for one or more profiles

compactLayoutAssignment.description: The compact layout that is assigned to the record type.

layout.description: The name or ID of the layout to assign for the profile

profile.description: The name or ID of the profile

layoutAssignmentOverrides.description: An (optional) array of page layout assignments overrides for one or more profiles

tools.name: apex_class_create
tools.description: Create a Salesforce Apex class

body.description: Full body of the Apex class

className.description: Name of the Apex class to create

apiVersion.description: Optional API version (for example: '63.0'). Defaults to the latest version.

tools.name: apex_class_update
tools.description: Update an existing Apex class in Salesforce

body.description: Full updated body of the Apex class

className.description: Name of the Apex class to update

tools.name: apex_trigger_create
tools.description: Create a Salesforce Apex trigger

body.description: Full body of the Apex trigger

sObject.description: The name of the sObject to which the trigger applies

apiVersion.description: Optional API version (for example: '63.0'). Defaults to the latest version.

triggerName.description: Name of the Apex trigger to create

tools.name: apex_trigger_update
tools.description: Update an existing Apex trigger in Salesforce

body.description: Full body of the Apex trigger

sObject.description: The name of the sObject to which the trigger applies

triggerName.description: Name of the Apex trigger to update

tools.name: metadata_describe
tools.description: Return a list of all the Salesforce metadata types available in the org, along with a few global properties of the org

verbose.description: If false or missing, return only the names of the metadata types. This is the default. If true, return additional properties for each type.

tools.name: metadata_list
tools.description: List Salesforce metadata elements of a specific type, optionally scoped by folder

folder.description: The folder name (optional). If not provided, all folders are searched.

tools.name: metadata_read
tools.description: Provide full details for one or more metadata elements of a specified type

fullNames.description: The full name(s) of the metadata elements to read.

tools.name: metadata_create
tools.description: Create one or more Salesforce metadata elements of a specified type

fullName.description: The full name of the metadata instance

metadata.description: The array of metadata records to create. Each record must include at least a 'fullName' property

tools.name: metadata_update
tools.description: Update one or more Salesforce metadata elements of a specified type.

upsert.description: Whether to upsert the metadata. If true, the metadata will be upserted (created if it does not yet exist). If false, the metadata will be updated.

fullName.description: The full name of the metadata instance

metadata.description: The array of metadata records to update. Each record must include at least a 'fullName' property and other required fields for the type. See instructions for details.

tools.name: metadata_delete
tools.description: Delete one or more metadata elements of a specified type in Salesforce. Maximum number is 10 per batch - DO NOT EXCEED.

fullNames.description: The full name(s) of the metadata element(s) to delete.

tools.name: tooling_api_query
tools.description: Runs a Salesforce Tooling API query to return a list of metadata objects

limit.description: The maximum number of records to return. The default is 100.

fields.description: List of fields to retrieve. May include relationship fields

sObject.description: The name of the Tooling API object to query

whereClause.description: WHERE clause. May include conditions on related objects

tools.name: tooling_api_search
tools.description: Runs a Tooling API search to return a list of matching metadata objects in Salesforce

query.description: The SOSL query to execute against the Tooling API. Please take into account all available documentation on object types, field names and limitations for the Tooling API SOSL queries

tools.name: tooling_api_dml

annotations.title: Perform DML operations on Salesforce Tooling API objects

tools.description: Perform DML operations on Salesforce Tooling API records. This function is used to create, update, delete, and upsert tooling API records in Salesforce.

record.description: The record to process, with all relevant fields. For an 'update' operation the record object must include an `Id` property`. For 'create' or 'upsert' the record may **not** have an `Id`. Do not use this property for the 'delete' operation

sObject.description: API name of the Tooling API object

recordId.description: Only used for the 'delete' operation: the ID of the record to delete

operation.description: Type of DML operation to perform. Always ask for explicit user approval before executing any of these operations, and do not proceed without it

externalIdField.description: External ID field name. Required for upsert operations, ignored in other cases

tools.name: tooling_api_describe
tools.description: Return a list of all the objects available through the Salesforce Tooling API. Use `tooling_api_query` with `FieldDefinition` to get the available fields for an object.

verbose.description: If false or missing, return only the names of the objects. This is the default. If true, return additional properties for each object.

tools.name: sobject_dml

annotations.title: Perform DML operations on Salesforce SObjects

tools.description: Perform DML operations on Salesforce records. This function is used to create, update, delete, and upsert records in Salesforce.

records.description: Array of records to process. For an 'update' operation the records must include an `Id` property`. For 'create' or 'upsert' the records may **not** have an `Id`. Do not use this property for the 'delete' operation

sObject.description: API name of the sObject

operation.description: Type of DML operation to perform. Always ask for explicit user permission before executing any of these operations

recordIds.description: Only used for the 'delete' operation: the IDs of the record to deletes

allOrNone.description: If true, the operation will fail if any of the records fail to be created, updated, or deleted. If false, the operation will continue even if some records fail. The default is false.

dmlOptions.description: Optional DML options to use for the operation

externalIdField.description: External ID field name. Required for upsert operations, ignored in other cases

tools.name: soql_query
tools.description: Runs a Salesforce SOQL query to return a list of sObject records. Encrypted fields are masked in the response

limit.description: The maximum number of records to return. The default is 100.

fields.description: List of fields to retrieve. May include relationship fields

orderBy.description: ORDER BY clause. May include fields from related objects

sObject.description: The name of the Salesforce object to query

whereClause.description: WHERE clause. May include conditions on related objects. Do NOT include APEX snippets or variables: use only literal values

tools.name: report_run
tools.description: Execute a Salesforce report and return its results

reportId.description: The ID of the report to execute (15 or 18 character Salesforce ID)

maxRecords.description: Maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 2000

includeDetails.description: Whether to include detailed row data in the response. Defaults to true

column.description: The field API name to filter on

operator.description: Filter operator (equals, notEqual, lessThan, greaterThan, etc.)

reportFilters.description: Additional filters to apply to the report

reportMetadata.description: Optional report metadata to override report configuration
